main_definition: A public area where people can engage in leisure activities, often featuring grassy areas, trees, benches, playgrounds, and walking paths.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move a vehicle to a stopped position
meanings_and_examples.example: When I got stuck in the traffic jam, I decided to park my car on the side of the road.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A recreational area with facilities for picnics and games
meanings_and_examples.example: We spent a lovely afternoon at the city park, enjoying a family picnic under the shade of trees.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of resting or relaxing in a public outdoor space
meanings_and_examples.example: After working hard all day, I wanted nothing more than to sit on a bench and just park myself at the local park for some peaceful time off.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A designated area where children can play freely
meanings_and_examples.example: The neighborhood park is great for kids because it has swings, slides, and plenty of open space to run around in.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used to describe a location without any specific designation or facilities
meanings_and_examples.example: Let's meet at the park next to my house; it doesn't have formal facilities, but we can sit on the grass and chat.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To temporarily stop working or cease an activity for a break
meanings_and_examples.example: During our long hike, I needed to park myself by the side of the trail to take a short rest and enjoy the view.
